text:
OFI
In this case study for 2022-2023 season , we choose OFI of Greek Super League and we search for a winger to add to the team. The algorithm suggest various wingers and we chose a winger from Serie B. Also in the next step we remove from our list a member of the current team , just to see how the wage budget of the team is reduced. In the last part of this case study, we run a simulation of the Greek Super League with an extra team which is OFI (Simulated Team) with the addition of the winger that the algorithm suggested and the removal of the player we chose.

title: Player Search & Scouting Based on FM
text:
Project Overview
This project uses Football Manager data to identify players that teams with limited scouting budget would not be possible to find.
The goal is to support low-budget scouting .

title: Player Search & Scouting Based on FM
text:
Live Application
Interactive scouting tool that supports squad planning and transfer decision-making using Football Manager data. The app allows users to view their current team, identify suitable player replacements or upgrades from the previous season, and simulate how proposed transfers affect squad strength, wage structure, and competitive performance under budget constraints.

title: Methodology
text:
Source: Kaggle (https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/furkanuluta/football-manager-22-complete-player-dataset)
Base Year : 2022-2023, for methodology evaluation and simulations
Previous Year : 2021-2022 , for players search
Player attributes

The process of evaluation how the data from FM in a specific league are close to reality is simple. First the Current Ability (CA) of each player is calculated , then for each team the average CA of the best 16 players is calculated (see Top.n).To assess how closely the FM data matches reality, teams are first ranked according to their CA values. The rank differences between the CA-based order and the actual league standings are then calculated to measure how far the FM rankings deviate from real performance.

Top.n = the best players of the team based on the CA , which are used for the evaluation of the teams’s CA.
Accuracy = represents the percentage of teams whose CA-based ranking matches their actual league position, indicating how many teams FM correctly places in the real standings.
MARE (Mean Absolute Rank Error) = represents the average difference between the ranking of each team based on FM’s CA and their actual league ranking.

title: Methodology
text:
Approach
The proposed approach is designed to remain as unbiased as possible by anchoring all player evaluation to the characteristics of the existing squad in the base year. Rather than searching the entire player universe, the model identifies players from the previous season whose profiles are comparable or improve upon to the players currently occupying each role in the team. This relative, role-based comparison ensures that recommendations are contextualized within the team’s actual needs and constraints, reducing selection bias and overfitting to league-wide averages.
By sourcing candidates from the prior year, the approach avoids forward-looking leakage while still capturing players with demonstrated performance stability. Once candidate players are identified, the framework evaluates how one or multiple transfers would alter the team’s internal dynamics, particularly in terms of collective ability and wage structure. This allows the user to assess not only individual upgrades but also the systemic impact of transfer decisions on squad balance and total budget, supporting informed trade-offs between performance gains and financial sustainability.

title: scouteR
text:
The live scouting app allows you to:

Choose your team
Search for possible transfers
Customize your team by adding and removing players
Run simulations to evaluate how the transfer effect the team



This component presents the baseline league table derived from FM based in the CA for the selected division. It serves as the reference point against which all subsequent analysis is performed, representing the expected competitive balance of the league before any squad modifications are introduced.



The My Team component displays the current squad of the selected club. It provides a clear overview of the team’s existing players position, wage, and CA, forming the structural and financial baseline used to evaluate potential improvements and transfers.



This component identifies candidate players from previous season whose profiles are comparable to, or improve upon, the current squad players by position. By conditioning recommendations on the characteristics of the existing team, the approach remains unbiased and context-aware, focusing on realistic upgrades rather than absolute star players.



This component merges the current squad with the shortlisted players into a single consolidated table. It enables direct evaluation of how prospective transfers alter the team’s overall composition and budget, including aggregated wage expenditure, while allowing users to remove players to test alternative squad configurations.



The simulation component evaluates the impact of the proposed squad changes on league performance. Adding a new team in the league which is the simulated team that the user created by combing the actual team with the transfers of that deemed worthy. Using algorithmic ranking and Monte Carlo simulations, it estimates how one or more transfers may influence league outcomes comparing the actual team with the simulated team while accounting for uncertainty, thereby linking recruitment decisions to expected competitive and financial consequences.
